title: (x) Thin stressed geometric sans in Another Magazine - Fashion Thin (proprietary face) {Mike F}
content:
A page from ANOTHER MAG, what is the typeface that used in “IN SOCIETY”?  
thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [in\_society.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925080745/http:/typophile.com/files/in_society.jpg) | 24.44 KB |

 [‹ (x) 'File Notes' rounded tech sans - Helix New {Meno Philips}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925080745/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34309 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Julia Rothman modern script - Digital Kauno {Angel} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925080745/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34361 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kib820

comments.content:
it really looks like my _[Miranda](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925080745/http:/typophile.com/node/34152)_ in an ultra light version! I’m curious to know what is this font too.

maybe some ultra light Peignot custom font… (but the S and the C don’t look like Peignot)

If Dennis Ortiz-Lopez had a [Radiant](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925080745/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/olradiant/) Ultra Light it would be a lot like this. I don’t think some white stroking would quite get it though, because the C isn’t quite as closed as the sample.

- Mike Yanega

Per [this MyFonts forum post](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925080745/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=24420) by Takeshi (a regular who is almost never wrong), it might be “Fashion Thin” by Alex Wiederin. Where he got the name from, I don’t know - but the typeface appears all over in the portfolio of [Buero New York](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925080745/http:/www.buero-newyork.com/). This includes several entries from Another Magazine.

I find the website very irritating to navigate.
Thanks, Yves. I’d forgotten about that thread.
